headerTitles.main: Project 'Landslide Risk Management in the Kyrgyz Republic'

results.one: Implementation of engineering measures to mitigate landslide consequences
results.two: Improvement of landslide monitoring systems locally and nationally
results.three: Enhancement of landslide risk management capacity

aboutProject.title: About Project
aboutProject.one: Located in a seismically active zone with a variable climate, the Kyrgyz Republic faces a high risk of geophysical disasters and climate change.
aboutProject.two: Frequent landslides, triggered by snowmelt, precipitation, and seismic activity, particularly in the Fergana Valley, pose a serious threat to life, infrastructure, and the economy. In response to these challenges, we are implementing the Asian Development Bank's first comprehensive landslide risk reduction project, aimed at protecting rural communities.
aboutProject.three: The project combines engineering and ecological approaches with community planning and capacity development, applying international experience and advanced technologies for effective monitoring and risk reduction.
aboutProject.four: The project goals include reducing losses from natural disasters and strengthening the protection of populations and territories for sustainable development, aiming to minimize vulnerability and landslide risk for communities and infrastructure.

partners.title: Partners
partners.one: Department of Monitoring and Forecasting of Emergencies at the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic
partners.two: Hydrometeorological Service at the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic
partners.three: Interregional Center for Territory Protection at the Ministry of Emergency Situations of the Kyrgyz Republic
